Bash(Layout" submenu with 2 radio-style options:
  * Vertical \(Stacked\) - Default, panels arranged top-to-bottom
  * Horizontal \(Side-by-Side\) - Panels arranged left-to-right
- Mutual exclusion between layout options \(radio button behavior\)
- Status bar feedback when layout changes
- _set_vertical_layout\(\) and _set_horizontal_layout\(\) methods

Layout Modes:

1. Vertical \(Stacked\) - DEFAULT:
   - Panels arranged vertically from top to bottom
   - Traditional timeline view style
   - Good for comparing trends across time
   - Drag horizontal dividers to resize
   - Best for tall/narrow displays

2. Horizontal \(Side-by-Side\):
   - Panels arranged horizontally from left to right
   - Compare different metrics simultaneously
   - Good for wide displays
   - Drag vertical dividers to resize
   - Best for ultra-wide monitors

Features:
- Instant layout switching via menu
- Panel sizes preserved during transition
- Works with all panel visibility states \(hidden/collapsed\)
- Collapsible panels work in both orientations
- Resize handles adapt to orientation

Use Cases:
- Ultra-wide monitors: Use horizontal layout for side-by-side comparison
- Standard displays: Use vertical layout for traditional timeline view
- Dual trends: Hide 3 panels, show 2 side-by-side in horizontal mode
- Battery + Settings: Show battery trend and settings side-by-side
- Lead comparison: Show atrial and ventricular impedance side-by-side

Technical Implementation:
- QSplitter orientation changed dynamically
- Panel sizes retrieved before orientation change
- Sizes reapplied after orientation change
- Menu actions maintain mutual exclusion
- Status bar provides user feedback

Workflow Example:
1. Start with vertical layout \(default\)
2. View > Layout > Horizontal \(Side-by-Side\)
3. Panels rearrange left-to-right instantly
4. Drag vertical dividers to adjust widths
5. Switch back to vertical anytime

Benefits:
- Flexibility for different display sizes
- Better use of ultra-wide monitors
- Side-by-side metric comparison
- Adapts to user preferences
- Professional multi-panel interface

Future Enhancements:
- Grid layout \(2x2, 2x3, etc.\)
- Custom panel arrangements
- Save layout preferences per patient
- Automatic layout based on screen size
